str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
No longer, no more. Also ouk eti from ou and eti; not yet, no longer.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
From pas and a derivative of rheo; all out-spokenness, i.e. Frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Ephraim, a city. Of Hebrew origin; Ephraim, a place in Palestine.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Feminine of a derivative of the base of chasma through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. A space of territory.
Near. From a primary verb agcho; near.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lonesome, i.e. waste.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
And there, and yonder, there also. From kai and ekei; likewise in that place.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
